title: Why are Tokyo's jazz bars disappearing (music, scenes, nightlife, culture, and Japan)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Another reason, in addition to other answers, is the age of the Jazz bar or jazz coffee shop owner. They are not getting younger! And no one wants to take over the place. Also, the older buildings where these places are located are starting to age badly and are in need to repairs. Recently a beloved Japanese curry restaurant had to close because the building is no longer safe.

The heyday of the jazz club jazz coffee shop was probably the 70s. These days there are less young people (aging population) and they have less discretionary spending ability, and there is less interest in jazz.
